com.sailthru.mobile.sdk

Class SailthruMobile

  • com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile

  • public class SailthruMobile

    Keeps track of necessary environment variables provided by the developer or google. Also provides the entry point into Sailthru Mobile for the developer to retrieve device information.

      • setInAppNotificationsEnabled

        public void setInAppNotificationsEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Enables or disables the display of In-App Notifications. Must be called before startEngine. In-App Notifications are enabled by default.

        Parameters:
        enabled - false to disable In-App Notifications and true to re-enable.
        See Also:
        startEngine

                        java.lang.String appKey)

        Parameters:
        context - Application Context
        appKey - The App Key of your application on the Sailthru Mobile platform.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if context or appKey are null.

      • setGeoIpTrackingEnabled

        @JvmOverloads
public void setGeoIpTrackingEnabled(boolean enabledGeoIp,
                                                  @Nullable
                                                  com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.SailthruMobileHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        Enabled location tracking based on IP Address. Tracking location tracking is enabled by default. Use this method for users who may not want to have their location tracked at all.

        Parameters:
        enabledGeoIp - A boolean value indicating whether or not to disable location based on IP Address.
        handler - Handler for the result of enabling/disabling geo IP tracking.

      • setGeoIpTrackingEnabled

        Parameters:

      • setGeoIpTrackingDefault

        public void setGeoIpTrackingDefault(boolean enabledGeoIp)

        Set whether location tracking based on IP Address will be enabled or disabled by default when a device is created. This method must be called before startEngine.

        Parameters:
        enabledGeoIp - A boolean value indicating whether or not location based on IP Address should be enabled by default.

      • getRecommendations

        public void getRecommendations(@NotNull
                               java.lang.String sectionId,
                               @Nullable
                               com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.RecommendationsHandler handler)

        Returns the output from a Site Personalization Manager section, an array of recommendations for the given user. It is suggested you use this in conjunction with setUserEmail to identify the user to Sailthru.

        Parameters:
        sectionId - A string representing the section ID for this recommendation
        handler - an anonymous instance of RecommendationsHandler. Must implement onSuccess() and onFailure().
        See Also:
        setUserEmail

      • trackPageview

        public void trackPageview(@NotNull
                          java.net.URI url,
                          @Nullable
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> tags,
                          @Nullable
                          com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.TrackHandler handler)

        Asynchronously registers that the given "page" has been viewed with Sailthru SPM. Note that a Content View here directly corresponds to a page view in SPM.

        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the page we're tracking a view of. Must be a valid URL with protocol (eg. http:// or https://) -this generally should correspond to the web link of the content being tracked, and thestored URL in the Sailthru content collection. This must not be null.
        tags - Tags for this page. May be null.
        handler - an instance of interface SailthruMobile.TrackHandler. May be null, in which case onSuccessand onFailure callbacks won't be fired.

      • trackImpression

        public void trackImpression(@NotNull
                            java.lang.String sectionId,
                            @Nullable
                            java.util.List<java.net.URI> urls,
                            @Nullable
                            com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.TrackHandler handler)

        Asynchronously registers an impression - a reasonable expectation that a user has seen a piece of content - with Sailthru SPM. Can be used in conjunction with RecyclerView.Adapter#onViewAttachedToWindow or similar to know when a particular content item has entered the user's viewport.

        Parameters:
        sectionId - the Section ID on Sailthru SPM corresponding to the section being viewed. Must not be null.
        urls - a List of the URLs of the items contained within this section. Useful if multiple itemsof content are contained within a section, otherwise just pass a single-item array.May be null.
        handler - an instance of interface SailthruMobile.TrackHandler. May be null, in which case onSuccessand onFailure callbacks won't be fired.

      • trackClick

        public void trackClick(@NotNull
                       java.lang.String sectionId,
                       @NotNull
                       java.net.URI url,
                       @Nullable
                       com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.TrackHandler handler)

        Asynchronously registers with Sailthru SPM that a section has been clicked/tapped on, transitioning the user to a detail view

        Parameters:
        sectionId - the ID of the section to track a click for. Must not be null.
        url - the URL of the detail being transitioned to. Must not be null.
        handler - an instance of interface SailthruMobile.TrackHandler. May be null, in which case onSuccessand onFailure callbacks won't be fired.

        Clear device data.

        Parameters:

      • setDeviceToken

        public void setDeviceToken(@Nullable
                           java.lang.String token)

        Pass the FCM token into the Sailthru Mobile SDK. NOTE: This method should only be called if the app implements its own FirebaseMessagingService instance, in which case it must be called in order to provide the FCM token to the Sailthru Mobile Platform. Otherwise this will be handled automatically by the Sailthru Mobile SDK.

        Parameters:
        token - FCM token provided by FirebaseMessagingService

      • handleNotification

        public void handleNotification(@NotNull
                               com.google.firebase.messaging.RemoteMessage remoteMessage)

        Pass received notification to Sailthru Mobile SDK. NOTE: This method should only be called if the app implements its own FirebaseMessagingService instance, in which case it must be called in order to provide FCM notifications to the Sailthru Mobile SDK for processing. Otherwise this will be handled automatically by the Sailthru Mobile SDK.

        Parameters:
        remoteMessage - FCM notification

        Set the profile vars through the SDK.

      • handleSailthruLink

        @NotNull
public android.net.Uri handleSailthruLink(@NotNull
                                                   android.net.Uri uri,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.SailthruMobileHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        If you're using Sailthru email with universal links, your application will open with an encoded Sailthru link url. This method will decode the link URL and return its canonical location (ie https://link.sailthru.com/blahblah will redirect to https://www.sailthru.com/careers/list/, the link's canonical location), as well as making sure that the clickthrough metrics for this link are correctly attributed in the Sailthru platform. This method should be called from your receiving activity's onStart() method, and handle the starting intent's link data

        Parameters:
        uri - the Sailthru Link to be unrolled
        Returns:
        the destination that the Sailthru link points to
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the URI given isn't a Sailthru link

      • logPurchase

        public void logPurchase(@NotNull
                        Purchase purchase,
                        @Nullable
                        com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.SailthruMobileHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        Logs a purchase with the Sailthru platform. This can be used for mobile purchase attribution.

        Parameters:
        purchase - The purchase to log with the platform.
        handler - callback handler.

        public void logAbandonedCart(@NotNull
                             Purchase purchase,

                             com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile.SailthruMobileHandler<java.lang.Void> handler)

        Logs a cart abandonment with the Sailthru platform. Use this to initiate cart abandoned flows.
